results.title: Fire and ice [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bakshi, Frank Frazetta and Polyc International
results.brief_description: This animated feature is set in a mythical Ice Age, where, Juliana, a powerful Queen of the North, seeks to gain control the rest of the realm. In this realm also resides the good King, Jarol, who lives in his fortress of fire and his sworn enemy, evil ice Lord Nekron, who lives with his army of subhumans amongst the glaciers. Nekron uses his powers of sorcery to create havoc and orders the subhumans to kidnap Jarol’s daughter. Thus a war is waged between fire and ice in a desperate battle for survival. Jarol, with help from the warrior hero Darkwolf must save mankind from the apocalyptic icy grave that awaits them if evil is to reign. Featuring the voices of Stephen Mendel, Maggie Roswell, Leo V. Gordon and Steve Sandor. Director Ralph Bakshi is best known for his animated adult feature “Fritz the cat”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Bakshi, Frank Frazetta and Polyc International

results.title: First born: the life and times of Jack Davis
results.creator_credit: Rene Roelofs, BBC Bookmark and Zest Films
results.brief_description: A portrait of aboriginal spokesman, story writer and distinguished playwright, Jack Davis. Positioned as he is at the end of a long line of oral story tellers and at the beginning of a blossoming written tradition, Jack Davis is unique. Since 1979, he has devoted his life to writing and has been able to combine the rigours of writing with the ever insistent demands of family and aboriginal politics. In 1989 he was granted an artistic endowment award in recognition of his contribution to Australian arts.
results.title_for_label: First born: the life and times of Jack Davis

results.title: Fire
results.creator_credit: Deepa Mehta, Bobby Bedi and Trial by Fire Films
results.brief_description: The first in a trilogy encompassing ‘Fire’, ‘Earth’ and ‘Water’, Deepa Mehta’s engrossing study of a lesbian affair interweaves sexual repression, pressure-cooker desire, crumbling patriarchy and cultural transformation in contemporary India. The tugging away of traditional structures reflects social changes and the tension of modernism occurring across the sub-continent. Radha, the driving force behind husband Ashok’s New Delhi restaurant, cohabits peacefully, if at times uneasily, with her in-laws upstairs. Their barren 15 year old marriage is rent asunder by the arrival of sister-in-law Sita, a confident modern young wife who poses questions Radha would rather not face. Their husbands’ complacency and neglect draws the women into a tender relationship which detonates into tragedy. Cast includes Shaban Azmi, Nandita Das, Kulbushan Kharband and Jaared Jaaferi. In English and Bengali with English subtitles.

results.title: First blood (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ted Kotcheff, Buzz Feitshans and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: His body and mind were brutally scarred from Vietnam. Then the small-town cop threatened him, abused and caged him like a wild animal - not like the hero he really was. They finally pushed him too far and all hell broke loose as he declared his own war against them. Rated: M Caption Version only Available.

results.title: First blood
results.creator_credit: Ted Kotcheff, Buzz Feitshans and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by David Morrell, “First Blood” began a trilogy of action films starring Sylvester Stallone as the tough but troubled Vietnam war veteran, John Rambo. Scarred from his horrific experiences in Vietnam, Rambo is abused by a power hungry “red-necked” sherriff in a small town who imprisons him. However, a caged Rambo is a dangerous beast and when he escapes the explosive action begins. Putting credibility aside, this is a prime example of the action movie genre which launched the careers of actors like Stallone, Schwarzenegger and Van Damme.

results.title: Fiorile
results.creator_credit: Paolo Taviani, Vittorio Taviani, Grazia Volpi, Filmtre-Gierre Film and Pentafilm
results.brief_description: A family travels through the Italian country side to visit their sick grandfather. On the journey two young children hear their father recount the story of their heritage. Spanning two centuries and beginning during the Napoleonic invasion of Italy, it centres around gold and its power to corrupt. A young soldier, Jean, left guarding the regiment’s chest of gold has it stolen while he is making love to a peasant girl, Elisabetta. The soldier is charged and will be put to death if the gold isn’t recovered. The thief, Elisabetta’s brother, will not own up and shame his family, the soldier is killed. This is the beginning of the family’s troubles, Elisabetta dies during childbirth and generations after are effected by the curse. Their surname Benedetti, meaning blessed, becomes known as “Maledetti”, cursed. The effect through the generations is emphasised by actors playing dual roles. Starring Claudio Bigali, Galatea Ranzi, Michael Vartan and Lino Capolicchio.

results.title: First aid: fire, accident and home safety
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Sally Collier, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to introduce the intellectual disability residential care worker to basic household precautions to avoid accident and fire, basic accident first aid techniques for use before the arrival of professional help, the different types of fire and how to deal with them and basic emergency procedures for evacuation and movement of residents in case of fire. Accompanied by 52p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Firm foundations
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A film on preparing a case for finance. Frank Ryan is in need of money to expand his business. Frank is a builder, and his old schoolfriend Bill Scully is the local bank manager. Frank and Bill arrange a meeting to sign up Frank for a loan. But Frank discovers things are not all that simple. On the day they were to meet, Bill Scully suffers a heart attack and the finances of Frank’s biggest client are frozen. Now Frank must persuade the bank’s temporary manager to finance him. Credits include: script by Bob Ellis; edited by Sarah Bennett; sound by Howard Spry; photography by Andrew Fraser. Cast includes: Henri Szeps and Graeme Blundell.

results.title: Fireman Sam
results.creator_credit: Ian Frampton, John Walker and Bumper Film
results.brief_description: Four stories featuring Fireman Sam and his friends in the town of Pontypandy narrated by John Alderton. The first story shows what happens when a trick is played on the fireman as a sticky substance is smeared on the fireman pole. There is a cat stuck up a tree in the second episode, a camping trip in the third and a special appearance on television by the Station Officer which excites the locals.

results.title: Fire on Heimaey
results.brief_description: This film shows the eruption on Heimaey Island: the eruption threatened to destroy Iceland’s most important fishing centre. The film also shows how the townspeople halted the devastation.
